didoss@... wrote:

> LOL,....yes, that is a whole other story,...it currently takes 4+ hours 
> to run our entire suite.  We use Mock objects, so that helps,...but we 
> don't use them everywhere.  We also utilize "TestAll" tests, so that 
> helps get you to a scope somewhere between one and all.

It takes 4 hours to run all your /programmer/ tests?! I daresay that is 
a large problem and needs attention! I could understand all your 
/customer/ tests taking that long to run, but not your programmer tests.

> We don't run into this often,...but it does happen, and I have asked 
> myself "Isn't there an easier way to find all the tests that might be 
> affected by my change?"

If you don't run into this often, then it might be that the cost of 
trying to do this more cleverly is higher than the cost of doing it the 
long way. Don't forget to consider that possibility.
